inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: known history of Sickle cell disease

inclusion.criterion: Hemoglobin greater than 5.5 grams per deciliter
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ApoA-1 level lower than 99 milligrams per deciliter
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: HDL-C level below 39 milligrams per deciliter
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Acute pain crisis requiring intravenous analgesics within the last week
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Hemoglobin SC disease, or hemoglobin A greater than 20%
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: no positive history of drug allergy

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: He won't smoke or uses any illicit drugs

exclusion.criterion: Serum creatinine greater than 2.0 milligram per deciliter
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient is afebrile within the normal blood pressure

exclusion.criterion: Serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT) greater than 3 times the upper limit of normal
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Uric acid level greater than 8 or history of gout
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of GI bleeding within the past 6 months
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Hemoglobin less than or equal to 5.5 grams per deciliter
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: No aspirin or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) for 1 week prior to forearm blood flow assessment and no caffeine the day of each forearm blood flow study
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects taking sildenafil, vardenafil, tadalafil, L-arginine, fibrates or inhaled nitric oxide within the last week will be excluded from the study
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Subjects taking any statin drug within the last four weeks will be excluded from the study
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subjects with significant cardiac disease and/or known peripheral Arterial disease
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has had positive history of sickle cell crises since childhood. He also had the same symptoms in past two weeks treated with oxycodone which was not beneficial to his pain.
